After talking to Inori, I called on Maika\nin her room.%K%P
'Maika? You there?'%K%P
'Sho...? It's open, come on in.'%K%P
'Thanks.'%K%P
Maika was sitting on her bed.\nHer eyes were red as if\nshe'd just been crying.%K%P
I didn't say anything yet, just sat down next to her.%K%P
'Have you been crying?'%K%P
'No... I'm just frustrated.'%K%P
'Frustrated?'%K%P
'Uh, yeah! I care about Akane and this building so\nmuch! I really thought we could get something done\nif we worked together.'%K%P
'But Akane doesn't care what happens to this\nplace. She never cared about it at all.'%K%P
'I couldn't stand hearing someone badmouth a place\nthat's so precious to you and me...'%K%P
Maika choked a little, lowering her head as if\ntrying to curl up into herself.%K%P
'Do you really think Akane hates it here?'%K%P
'What...? Whose side are you on?'%K%P
'Yours, of course. But that doesn't mean I'm\nagainst Akane. Think back, did she ever say\nthat she hated being here?'%K%P
'She said she didn't care if it got knocked down!'%K%P
'No, she said she couldn't stand you trying to\ndictate what she got to do.'%K%P
'It's the same thing! I was doing it to try and\nsave Tsuba--'%K%P
'That's your problem, right there. You wanted to\nsave this building. But did you think\nabout how Akane felt?'%K%P
'I'm sorry to say this, but at this rate I think it\nmight be for the best if this place\ncloses down, too.'%K%P
Maika's eyes went wide with shock.%K%P
Maybe that was too harsh.%K%P
But I think it was what she needed to hear.%K%P
'Maika. In your mind, what kind of place is\nTsubaki?'%K%P
'Huh? Well...it's our home.\nIt's a place full of memories\nof my time with you.'%K%P
'So, what do we have to do to protect this\nhome of ours?'%K%P
'Rehabilitate Akane...?'%K%P
'Good answer, but I think we can do better.\nRehabilitating Akane would help,\nbut is that all you want?'%K%P
'Is your dream to make this into a place where\nwe try to control the goddesses that live here?'%K%P
'That's...'%K%P
'Maika, I know we're running out of time.\nBut I think you were in the wrong here.'%K%P
I knew how she felt. I wanted to protect\nthis place, too.%K%P
But at what cost?%K%P
'Do you think of Tsubaki as a place where people\nare forced into doing things?'%K%P
'No... When I think of Tsubaki, it's a kind place, a\nplace full of people who are friends.'%K%P
'That's how I think of it, too.'%K%P
'That's why if we really want Akane to help, we can't\nbully her, we need her to like living here so that\nshe wants to save it just as much as we do.'%K%P
We had to stay true to the sprirt of Tsubaki\nApartments.%K%P
I didn't want Maika to lose sight\nof something so important.%K%P
As I spoke, Maika started to slump over like all her\nenergy was draining out of her.%K%P
'Now that I think about it, I got so fixated on you\nand me and protecting our house that I forgot this is\nsupposed to be Akane and Inori's home, too.'%K%P
'I tried to push my own feelings onto Akane.\nThat wasn't right.'%K%P
'I probably should have said something sooner.'%K%P
'No, don't worry about it.\nI'm just grateful you stopped me from\nmaking the same mistake again.'%K%P
'Fixating on the past too much could rob this\nplace of its future.'%K%P
'I'll apologize to Akane. And I'll find a way\nto show her what a great place Tsubaki Apartments\ncan be.'%K%P
'You are sounding a lot happier now.\nI'm proud of you, and I know you can do it!'%K%P
'Thanks to you.'%K%P
Maika's eyes were no longer bleary and sorrowful.\nNow they were alight with determination.%K%P
'That's the Maika I know and love.'%K%P
I gave her an encouraging pat on the shoulder.%K%P
'Thanks again, Sho.'%K%P
'Anytime.'%K%P
We were quiet then, and sat in each other's arms\nfor just a little longer.%K%P
Having realized the error of her ways, Maika\ncalled Inori and Akane into the living room\nthe next day.%K%P
Unsurprisingly, Akane was sulking and refused to\nlook any of us in the eyes.%K%P
'I'm just here because Sho asked me.\nIf Maika's gonna lecture me again,\nI'm going back to my room.'%K%P
'That's not it.\nJust hear what she has to say.'%K%P
'Yes, Akane, at least withhold your judgment\nuntil then.'%K%P
'Okay, fine.\nBut I'm just gonna switch off\nif things start getting boring.'%K%P
Akane had been about to get up, but we managed to\nconvince her to stay put a while longer.%K%P
I couldn't have this conversation falling apart\nbefore it had even started.%K%P
At a signal from me, Maika began to speak.%K%P
We'd agreed that she was going to tell Akane\nhow she honestly felt, and that I would\ninterfere as little as possible.%K%P
'Before we go any further, I want to apologize.\nI'm sorry for not considering your feelings\nbefore, Akane.'%K%P
'Huh?!'%K%P
Akane's eyes nearly popped out of their sockets.%K%P
'I thought about it, and you were right. I was only\nthinking of myself. I shouldn't have tried to force\nyou into doing things my way.'%K%P
'I don't expect you to forgive me,\nbut I needed to say this.\nI really am truly sorry.'%K%P
'I... Uh...Maika, don't worry. I forgive you.'%K%P
Maika sighed in relief before moving on.%K%P
'Thank you. Now for the reason I've called you here.\nI have a request for both of you.'%K%P
'A request?'%K%P
'Yes. I want you two to fall in love with\nTsubaki Apartments.'%K%P
'Huh? What do you mean?'%K%P
'This building has absorbed all the memories\nof the people who've lived here.\nThe good times and the bad.'%K%P
'I love this place. I want to protect it.\nI want you two to feel the same.'%K%P
'What, by forcing me to change?'%K%P
'No. How do I put this...? Sho, what does\nTsubaki mean to you?'%K%P
'Huh? You're asking me?'%K%P
What did this place mean to me?%K%P
'Well, it's my home and it's important to me.\nI've spent a lot of time here with people\nI care about.'%K%P
'How about you, Inori?'%K%P
'Me? Well, I think it's a peaceful place.\nA place its residents find comfortable.'%K%P
Just the kind of answer I'd expect from Inori.%K%P
'And you, Akane? What kind of place do you think\nTsubaki Apartments is?'%K%P
'...It's full of annoying busybodies.\nBut the food's good.'%K%P
Akane was still grumpy,\nbut at least she answered\nMaika's question.%K%P
'How about for you, Maika?'%K%P
'Me? To me, Tsubaki Apartments is a place where I\ncan meet lots of wonderful people.'%K%P
'It's not just where you've lived with Sho?'%K%P
'I can't deny that's part of it. But it's all the\nencounters that make it really precious to me.'%K%P
'I've lived here all my life.\nPeople have come and gone, and I even\ngot to meet goddesses here.'%K%P
'That's why I want to make this a place where humans\nand goddesses can live together and learn\nfrom each other.'%K%P
'I don't get it.'%K%P
'Well, I used to think Aragami were really scary.'%K%P
'But after getting to know you, Akane, I've come\nto realize that they're just very honest and direct\nabout their feelings.'%K%P
'I want to help bridge the gap between Aragami\nand humans, to help them be accepted in society.'%K%P
Maika started to get really passionate as\nshe described her ambition.%K%P
It was still vague, with no definite plan,\nbut her enthusiasm seemed to shine through\nin every word she spoke.%K%P
'I want to make this a place that you'll love just\nas much as I do. Right now, I want that more\nthan anything.'%K%P
'I won't interfere with your rehabilitation anymore.\nI just want to show you what kind of place\nTsubaki Apartments really is.'%K%P
'And if you do start to like it, and want to\nsave it, then we can see how it goes from there.\nThat's all.'%K%P
Maika bowed her head.\nAkane still looked sour as she\ntook this all in.%K%P
'And that's your request?'%K%P
'Yes.'%K%P
'What if I say I'm giving up on rehab?'%K%P
'Then I'll give up on that dream.\nIf I can't get you to love this place,\nI don't deserve anything more.'%K%P
'But I really will do everything in my power to make\nTsubaki Apartments a place you can call home.'%K%P
Akane's expression slowly started to soften.%K%P
'Okay... Fine.'%K%P
'What's that mean--'%K%P
'It's not like I hate it here or anything. Besides,\nI am your household goddess. I can't ignore such\nan earnest prayer.'%K%P
'So you'll help?'%K%P
'You did accept me even though I'm an Aragami.\nInviting a few others here could be fun.'%K%P
'I think your dream sounds fantastic.\nFor what it's worth, I'll do anything I can to help!'%K%P
'Akane... Inori...'%K%P
'Don't forget me.'%K%P
'Of course... Thank you all so much!'%K%P
Maika broke into tears of joy.%K%P
'I'll go along with rehab again.\nJust go easy on me, okay?\nI can't keep up anything too demanding.'%K%P
'Sure. I'll tear up that dumb schedule.'%K%P
'Then everything's fine! Friends?'%K%P
'Friends. Thanks, Akane.'%K%P
Maika and Akane shook hands and made up.%K%P
Their past animosity disappeared like mist in the\nmorning sun.%K%P
